title: Barrhead cruising for customers
text:
Save 
Barrhead Travel is holding a cruise show at its flagship Glasgow store on Saturday. 
The Scottish agency will hold the event for the public at its Oswald Street branch with staff from Jamie’s Italian and Marco Pierre White Steakhouse handing out cruise inspired food too. Both Jamie Oliver and Marco Pierre White have shipborne restaurants. 
Barrhead Travel chief executive Sharon Munro said: “We want potential holidaymakers to come along to find out more about the cruise packages we offer and get involved in all the fun.” 
The news comes as the agency reports a 25% year-on-year increase in passengers booking river cruises since the start of the year. 
Top destinations for 2015 include the Rhine, the Danube, the Elbe and the Douro, and bookings for trips along the Yangtze in Asia and the Irrawaddy in Burma are on the up. 
In addition, customers are booking more experiential trips like travelling via steamboat on the Mississippi, while couples are increasingly booking romantic cruises. 
Munro added: “People are looking for unforgettable, authentic, once-in-a-lifetime experiences and holidaymakers are now much more willing to travel further afield. 
“River cruising is a great way to get to the heart of these exotic locations. 
“With the increase in interest around rivers like the Yangtze and the Irrawaddy, we’re sure that this is a trend that will continue to grow.”
